org.gridfour.imaging.palette

Class ColorPaletteRecordHSV

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gridfour.imaging.palette.ColorPaletteRecord
      • org.gridfour.imaging.palette.ColorPaletteRecordHSV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<ColorPaletteRecord>

    public class ColorPaletteRecordHSV
extends ColorPaletteRecord
    Defines a color palette record based on the HSV model. Note, this model is not to be confused with the Java HSB model. The Java model expects hue in the range 0 to 1, while the HSV model expects hue in the range 0 to 360.

    Note that the value for hues may be either increasing or decreasing.

    This class interpolates S and V (saturation and value) parameters independently using linear interpolation. Hues are also interpolated using linear methods, but special rules apply for cases where the specified hue values cross the zero-angle. For example, if hues range from 350 to 10, then the midpoint between the angles is assumed to be zero (because the shortest path between 350 degrees and 10 degrees is a span of 20 degrees). Similar logic would apply for hues spanning from 10 to 350. The shortest path would place zero degrees at the midpoint between the two parameters.

    Note that because the class assumes the shortest angular path between hues, a span of hues can never exceed 180 degrees. Application developers should take care to avoid ambiguous cases by never allowing a span greater than or equal to 180 degrees (i.e. should use multiple sequential records to avoid ambiguity).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorPaletteRecordHSV

        public ColorPaletteRecordHSV(double range0,
                             double range1,
                             double[] hsv0,
                             double[] hsv1)
        Constructs a record for the specified ranges and selections of HSV. HSV values are expected to be supplied as an array of dimension 3, giving values in the order: hue, saturation, and value.
        Parameters:
        range0 - the minimum for the record's range of values
        range1 - the maximum for the record's range of values
        hsv0 - the color values associated with range0
        hsv1 - the color values associated with range1

    • Method Detail

      • getArgb

        public int getArgb(double z)
        Description copied from class: ColorPaletteRecord
        Gets an ARGB value for the specified parameter, if available. Implementations of this method generally expect that the value for z will be in the range of values that was specified to their constructor. The behavior of this method when supplied values out of range is undefined, though in many cases classes will simply constrain the input value to the supported range.
        Specified by:
        getArgb in class ColorPaletteRecord
        Parameters:
        z - a valid floating point value
        Returns:
        if a color is defined for z, its associated ARGB value; otherwise the null-value code.

      • getBaseColor

        public Color getBaseColor()
        Description copied from class: ColorPaletteRecord
        Gets the color for the minimum value in the range specified by this record. This method is intended primarily to support categorical palettes. It can also be useful in creating legends and keys in graphical presentations.
        Specified by:
        getBaseColor in class ColorPaletteRecord
        Returns:
        a valid Color instance.
